basic.floral_language:
Echeveria macdougallii
Floriography:pink, exquisite, pure
Echeveria macdougallii has smooth, long oval leave with slight tip at top, loosely arranged in a rosette form. In cool and sunny season, leaves turn red, otherwise green. Quite popular recently for the bright colors and high ornamental value.
Echeveria macdougallii likes light, no apparent dormancy, avoid strong sunlight in summer noon time. Sometimes blooms with orange flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny leaf color turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate light, no apparent period of dormancy, shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once every month
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
